description: Charlotte Bright, charged in the deaths of 14 horses between Feb. 1 and April 8, 2023 has elected to be tried by a Court of King's Bench judge without a jury.Bright was charged with three criminal offences.

title: BVA responds to Government proposals to reform Veterinary Medicines Regulations
description: The British Veterinary Association (BVA) has broadly welcomed the publication of the Government’s plans to reform the Veterinary Medicines Regulations (VMR) in Great Britain. The proposed amendments to the 2013 Regulations follow a consultation last year, which BVA jointly responded to alongside several of its specialist divisions.

description: The Food Matters in Prisons report, issued last month, calls for greater transparency and accountability around food procurement

title: Slovakia’s Robert Fico under pressure to ditch plan to close anti-corruption office
description: Slovakia’s Eurosceptic premier Robert Fico is under increased pressure from opposition parties, street protests and the EU not to go ahead with plans to close down the country’s anti-corruption office.

title: Nigel Farage won’t stand as MP, Reform leader hints
description: Richard Tice suggests Farage will support the party's general election campaign, but will not make an eighth attempt to become an MP

title: Michael Kelly: Down and Connor can expect Bishop Alan McGuckian to lead a journey of reform
description: Known as personable and hard-working, Bishop McGuckian was a close adviser to the somewhat more distant Bishop Noel Treanor, who never gave any strong indication that he enjoyed being in Down and Connor as bishop from 2008 until his 2022 appointment as the Pope’s ambassador to Brussels.

title: Politics latest news: Labour starts pre-election talks with civil service
description: Reform UK has hit its highest ever level of support in crucial Red Wall seats, according to a new poll. A Redfield & Wilton Strategies survey, conducted between Jan 30-31, put Richard Tice’s party on 14 per cent of the vote. That was up by three points when compared to the company’s previous poll conducted between Dec 17-18.

title: Rishi Sunak must get a grip or go now, writes Robert Taylor

title: Sysco GB advocates for apprenticeship levy education reform
description: Sysco GB is pushing for the current apprenticeship levy to encompass wider education funding, including adult learning and literacy and numeracy schemes for its existing staff.

description: Reform UK has hit its highest ever level of support in crucial Red Wall seats, according to a new poll. title: Finnish strikes over labour reform empty Helsinki
description: Public transport ground to a halt across much of Finland on Friday as part of mass strikes over the government's proposed labour reforms, leaving Helsinki's normally-bustling city centre unusually quiet.

title: Financial uncertainty at UK councils undermining net-zero progress, Government warned
description: UK100 urges a major policy reform to enable local authorities to meet net-zero targets, warning short fixes won't resolve the £4bn funding shortfall looming through to 2026.

title: The loan charge is ruining lives and failing to stop 'dodgy umbrella companies', leading MP warns
description: MPs and industry leaders are calling on the Government to impose regulations on rogue umbrella companies who exploit workers and cheat the taxman.

title: Uzbekistan ‘welcomes scrutiny’ amid 2023 cotton harvest forced labour claims
description: A report has alleged some forced labour took place during Uzbekistan's 2023 cotton harvest, raising concerns on the need for urgent reform.

description: Former lord chancellor concerned about speed of progress on financial remedies with several months to go until Law Commission 'scoping paper' published.

title: Michael Russell confirmed as new Scottish Land Commission chair
description: The Scottish Government has announced the appointment of a new chair and two new members to the board of the Scottish Land Commission. Michael Russell replaces the outgoing Andrew Thin, while Craig Mackenzie and Deb Roberts have been appointed as commissioners.

title: A new type of student-loan forgiveness is coming this month
